channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 12 Disgraceful Acts Biden Has Committed (So Far) On His Way Out The White House Door

item.title: Perplexity said to submit bid to merge with TikTok’s US unit
item.description: TikTok’s China-based parent company is required to find a buyer for its US operations or face a shutdown on Sunday under the law.

item.title: Garland’s Cynical Rescission of the Death Penalty Protocol
item.description: The outgoing Biden-Harris administration and its AG continue to play a political game with capital punishment.

item.title: Houston’s Bayou Bend: The Origin Story of Texan High Culture
item.description: The visionary Ima Hogg bought the best old American furniture, silver, ceramics, and textiles to inspire good taste in design.

item.title: US TikTok users lose access to app ahead of Sunday deadline
item.description: “A law banning TikTok has been enacted in the U.S.,” according to an in-app pop-up message. “Unfortunately, that means you can’t use TikTok for now.”

item.title: Real estate brokers seek special exemptions from LA’s ‘mansion tax’ and key rules to spur rebuilding after wildfires
item.description: "The City should not impose taxes on individuals who lost their homes in the fires."

item.title: Trump family returns to nation's capital ahead of Inauguration Day: 'This time, America won'
item.description: President-elect Trump and his family departed Florida, beginning a historic return to Washington, D.C., for his second presidential inauguration.

item.description: “If I decide to do that, I’ll probably announce it on Monday,” he said.

item.title: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to what snowball fights have to do with moving the inauguration inside
item.description: With the President-elect's Inauguration moved inside the Capitol, House and Senate offices are becoming frustrated about who may be allowed to attend.

item.title: Here Are The 37 Brutal Murderers Joe Biden Let Off Death Row
item.description: A rundown of the gruesome murders committed by the death-row inmates getting commutations by President Joe Biden.

item.title: Apex Trump

item.description: Botching the small details only gives critics license to revel in their sense of superiority, even when the big-picture allegations are correct.

item.title: Trump wants to visit China again after he takes office: report
item.description: President-elect Trump is interested in heading back to China after he takes office again amid tensions with Beijing, according to a report.

item.title: Trump nominates Penny Schwinn for deputy secretary of US Department of Education
item.description: President-elect Trump tapped Penny Schwinn, a former Tennessee education commissioner, for deputy secretary of the U.S. Department of Education.
